content: i designed this towel topper specifically for towels with cute designs on the front i also wanted to create one that was a bit more polished in appearance using single_crochet instead of the usual double_crochet stitches they were also a big hit at my vendor markets this year too supplies needed -approx 55-65 yards of any size 4 worsted weight yarn -size j 6 0 mm hook or size needed to obtain gauge -1 kitchen towel size 14 x 24 35 5 x 70 cm -1 button size 1 25 mm -tapestry needle may need to be on the sharper side if your towel is thicker -seam gauge or regular ruler or even better is a quilting ruler that is 6 wide for both the markings and the folding instructions -pen or marker for marking on towel -iron and ironing board -scissors measuring tape stick pins terms used and abbreviations pattern is written in us terminology beginning - beg chain - chain fasten_off - fo repeat - repeat single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet 2 together - decrease slip_stitch es - slip_stitch s stitch es - st s space s - space s together - decrease gauge 16 single_crochet and 16 row = 4 10 cm finished measurements crocheted portion measures approx 5 x 7 5 13 x 19 cm i have also included a youtube video tutorial to help with the most difficult portions of the pattern you can also find this pattern on my blog at daysck com **there are no refunds for the purchase of my digital patterns my patterns have been tested and edited accordingly however there may still be lingering errors as i am human if you encounter an error please notify me and i will be happy to make the suggested edits and send you the corrected copy if necessary **
